  • Method Details

    • calcTotalAmt

      public static double calcTotalAmt​(int bill20, int bill10, int bill5, int bill1, int coin25, int coin10, int coin5, int coin1)
      calcTotalAmount calculates the total amount the customer paid using the number of bills passed in to the method.
      Parameters:
      bill20 - Number of twenty dollar bills the customer paid with.
      bill10 - Number of ten dollar bills the customer paid with
      bill5 - Number of five dollar bills the customer paid with.
      bill1 - Number of one dollar bills the customer paid with.
      coin25 - Number of quarters the customer paid with.
      coin10 - Number of dimes the customer paid with.
      coin5 - Number of nickels the customer paid with.
      coin1 - Number of pennies the customer paid with.
      Returns:
      The total amount paid by the customer.

    • calcChange

      public static int[] calcChange​(double usdChange)
      calcChange converts the USD change passed into the function to Euros and then figures out the amount of each Euro bill/coin to give back to the customer. To account for the double having more decimal places than we need, I multiply the value by 100 and then cast it to an int to get rid of those decimal places.
      Parameters:
      usdChange - Change in USD that was calculated in main.
      Returns:
      The array of each Euro bill/coin that the customer is going to receive.

    • main

      public static void main​(String[] args)
      The first user input is the price of the item the customer intends to buy. The second is the number of each bill/coin the customer gives to the cashier. After calling calcTotalAmt and storing the value in amountPaidWith, main calculates the change that is to be given by subtracting the item price from the amount paid with and passes that into calcChange.
      Parameters:
      args - Standard parameter
